articles.author: JOSEF FEDERMAN, WAFAA SHURAFA and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The Israeli military on Wednesday said it had uncovered a major Hamas command center in the heart of Gaza City, inflicting what it described as a serious blow to the Islamic militant group as pressure grows on Israel to scale back its devastating military offensive in the coastal enclave.
articles.title: Israel uncovers major Hamas command center in Gaza City as cease-fire talks gain momentum

articles.author: JOSHUA GOODMAN, ERIC TUCKER and REGINA GARCIA CANO
articles.description: MIAMI (AP) — The United States freed a close ally of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro in exchange for the release of 10 Americans imprisoned in the South American country and the return of a fugitive defense contractor known as “Fat Leonard” who is at the center of a massive Pentagon bribery scandal, the Biden administration announced Wednesday.
articles.title: US, Venezuela swap prisoners: Maduro ally for 10 Americans, plus fugitive contractor 'Fat Leonard'

articles.author: NICHOLAS RICCARDI
articles.description: DENVER (AP) — Former President Donald Trump's bid to win back the White House is now threatened by two sentences added to the U.S. Constitution 155 years ago.The Colorado Supreme Court on Tuesday barred Trump from the state's ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, which prohibits anyone who swore an oath to support the Constitution and then “engaged in insurrection” against it from holding office.
articles.title: The Constitution's insurrection clause threatens Trump's campaign. Here is how that is playing out

articles.author: BARRY HATTON
articles.description: The year started with high hopes for Ukrainian troops planning a counteroffensive against Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine ends year disappointed by stalemate with Russia, and anxious about aid from allies

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES, LISA MASCARO and REBECCA SANTANA
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Amid grueling negotiations, the contours of a bipartisan border security and immigration deal are beginning to take shape, emerging even as Congress leaves town having failed to publicly unveil any details of the package that's central to unlocking stalled aid for Ukraine.
articles.title: A deal on US border policy is closer than it seems. Here's how it is shaping up and what's at stake

articles.author: BILL BARROW
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — Some top Democrats are worried that a dip in Black voter turnout, along with other challenges, could doom President Joe Biden and his party in 2024.
articles.title: Biden needs a new approach to Black voters based on Georgia and Michigan, group of strategists says

articles.author: ED WHITE, DEL QUENTIN WILBER and MADDY PEEK
articles.description: DETROIT (AP) — The serial killer lured women one by one into vacant homes to be murdered, posing their nude or partially clothed corpses amid cheap booze pints, crumbling sheetrock and hypodermic needles.
articles.title: 'Total systemic breakdown': Missteps over years allowed Detroit serial killer to roam free

articles.author: KEN MORITSUGU
articles.description: BEIJING (AP) — China’s prospects for 2024 look uncertain, as a year that opened free of COVID-19 lockdowns winds down without the dreamed of robust recovery for the world’s No. 2 economy.The wars in Gaza and Ukraine are straining China’s ties with the West.
articles.title: China emerged from 'zero-COVID' in 2023 to confront new challenges in a changed world

articles.author: CHRISTOPHER WEBER
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — A federal judge on Wednesday blocked a California law that would have banned carrying firearms in most public places, ruling that it violates the Second Amendment of the U.S. Constitution and deprives people of their ability to defend themselves and their loved ones.
articles.title: Federal judge blocks California law that would have banned carrying firearms in most public places

articles.author: HEATHER HOLLINGSWORTH
articles.description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. (AP) — A romance that united sports and music fans, a celestial wonder that drew millions of eyes skyward and a spiritual homecoming for some Native American tribes were just some of the moments that inspired us and brought joy in 2023.
articles.title: Taylor Swift's new romance, debt-erasing gifts and the eclipse are among most joyous moments of 2023
